intro: Piptostylis indica, commonly known as the Indian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
